t: Psalm 103
Praise for the Lord’s Mercies.
A Psalm of David.
Bless*pn the Lord,*s O my soul, And*ln all that is within me, bless*i His holy name.
Bless*ln the Lord,*s O my soul, And*ln forget none of His benefits;
Who*ln pardons all your iniquities, Who*ln heals all your diseases;
Who*ln redeems your life from the pit, Who*ln crowns you with lovingkindness and compassion;
Who*ln satisfies your years with good things, So*iln that*i your youth is renewed like the eagle.
The*ln Lord*s performs righteous deeds And*ln judgments for all who are oppressed.
He*ln made known His ways to Moses, His*ln acts to the sons of Israel.
The*ln Lord*s is compassionate and gracious, Slow*ln to anger and abounding in lovingkindness.
He*ln will not always strive with*i us,*i Nor*ln will He keep His*i anger*i forever.
He*ln has not dealt with us according to our sins, Nor*ln rewarded us according to our iniquities.
For*ln as high as the heavens are above the earth, So*ln great is His lovingkindness toward those who fear Him.
As*ln far as the east is from the west, So*ln far has He removed our transgressions from us.
Just*ln as a father has compassion on his*i children, So*ln the Lord*s has compassion on those who fear Him.
For*ln He Himself knows our frame; He*ln is mindful that we are but*i dust.
As*ln for man, his days are like grass; As*ln a flower of the field, so he flourishes.
When*ln the wind has passed over it, it is no more, And*ln its place acknowledges it no longer.
But*ln the lovingkindness of the Lord*s is from everlasting to everlasting on those who fear Him, And*ln His righteousness to children’s children,
To*ln those who keep His covenant And*ln remember His precepts to do them.
The*ln Lord*s has established His throne in the heavens, And*ln His sovereignty rules over all.
Bless*ln the Lord,*s you His angels, Mighty*ln in strength, who perform His word, Obeying*ln the voice of His word!
Bless*ln the Lord,*s all you His hosts, You*ln who serve Him, doing His will.
Bless*ln the Lord,*s all you works of His, In*ln all places of His dominion; Bless*ln the Lord,*s O my soul!
